weekly_top_story.headline: Congo and Rwanda Presidents to Meet in US to Sign Peace Deal
weekly_top_story.summary: The presidents of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are set to meet in the United States to sign a peace agreement, marking a major diplomatic breakthrough after years of regional conflict and instability.

stories.headline: Sri Lanka Declares State of Emergency After Cyclone Ditwah
stories.summary: Sri Lanka has declared a state of emergency and is seeking international aid after Cyclone Ditwah displaced tens of thousands and caused widespread damage, highlighting the growing threat of extreme weather events in South Asia.

stories.headline: Airlines Worldwide Cancel Flights Due to Airbus A320 Software Glitch
stories.summary: Hundreds of flights were canceled globally as airlines urgently updated software on over 6,500 Airbus A320 jets, underscoring the vulnerability of critical aviation infrastructure to technical failures.

stories.headline: African Union Suspends Guinea-Bissau After Military Coup
stories.summary: The African Union has suspended Guinea-Bissau following a military coup, signaling strong regional opposition to unconstitutional power grabs and raising concerns about democratic backsliding in West Africa.
